channel.title: Nice dev console
channel.description:
http://services.runescape.com/m=news/z-buffering
[b]We've enabled access to our developer console to allow players a small selection of commands, which you may prove useful in tracking down the cause of more technical issues with the client on your computer. Just hit the back quote key (`), also known as the grave accent key, which is found left of the '1' key on most QWERTY keyboards. Input 'help' into the developer console for more information and a list of available commands.[/b]
http://www.uppimg.com/W2298OE.png

item.title: Nice dev console
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:14, topic:360504”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=456820.msg3343525#msg3343525 date=1284607626]

[quote author=zachera link=topic=456820.msg3343518#msg3343518 date=1284607355]

Little late aren’t you? Anyhow, I’ll just quote my earlier post from MoparScape about it:

The commands have always been there, just disabled for the version users could use. I always used to enable them back when I had the MoparScape Revolution cheat client out there, so you could use them on the official runescape, I guess it’s about time they let everyone use them without hacks.

[/quote]Well, I don’t visit MoparScape often, but interesting. How long have these been available for ‘hacking awake’?
[/quote]early rt5

Way earlier than that, they have been available since at least as early as 317, probably the beginning of RS2.[/quote]it’s been there since the beta

Read full topic

item.title: Nice dev console
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Ollie:

Inb4exploit

This doesn’t change anything, it’s just a new interface to access it.

If anything though, it will give more people an idea of how it works(or that it exists), and those that know how to do it might be tempted to exploit it

Read full topic

item.title: Nice dev console

item.title: Nice dev console
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Client modification got ‘big’ on the rsbot forums probably 6 months ago, it was big for a few weeks then died back down. There were a few clients released on there that had the ability to use :: commands enabled, and that worked for all the build information, fps, etc.

And yes, the ::command feature has been around for as long as I can remember, which has been quite a while, far earlier than rt5… You weren’t able to type ::(anything) until a few months ago(or else it would just disappear) when they removed it. I’m guessing that’s when they implemented the dev console for staffers, and now they’ve just released a limited version to us.

Read full topic

The commands have always been there, just disabled for the version users could use. I always used to enable them back when I had the MoparScape Revolution cheat client out there, so you could use them on the official runescape, I guess it’s about time they let everyone use them without hacks.

[/quote]Well, I don’t visit MoparScape often, but interesting. How long have these been available for ‘hacking awake’?
[/quote]early rt5[/quote]

Way earlier than that, they have been available since at least as early as 317, probably the beginning of RS2.

item.title: Nice dev console
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:10, topic:360504”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=456820.msg3343775#msg3343775 date=1284645192]

It shows the build number, should be an easy hook.
[/quote]or you can just use the login block, as it will be backwards compatible

Use both. Why the fuck would a hook need to be backwards compatible? More like forwards compatible.[/quote]You’ve never needed to run your updater on an older client? And why the fuck would you use both? Unless you’re a complete fucktard, grabbing it from the login block will never fail.

Read full topic

item.title: Nice dev console
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

I would love to see a nice bug with this and have let you change a whole bunch of stuff in your client. I do find it nice that I don’t have to use a 3rd party program to display my FPS anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: Nice dev console
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:4, topic:360504”][quote author=zachera link=topic=456820.msg3343518#msg3343518 date=1284607355]

[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=456820.msg3343515#msg3343515 date=1284607149]
Little late aren’t you? Anyhow, I’ll just quote my earlier post from MoparScape about it:

The commands have always been there, just disabled for the version users could use. I always used to enable them back when I had the MoparScape Revolution cheat client out there, so you could use them on the official runescape, I guess it’s about time they let everyone use them without hacks.

[/quote]Well, I don’t visit MoparScape often, but interesting. How long have these been available for ‘hacking awake’?
[/quote]early rt5[/quote]Well, the commands (::fpson, ::prefetchmusic, ::noclip) have been available for that amount of time, yes, but I’m talking specifically about the developer console. That purple box stuff – doesn’t seem like that has been around for a long time – they wouldn’t put that there without a reason.

Read full topic

@moparisthebest wrote:

Little late aren’t you? Anyhow, I’ll just quote my earlier post from MoparScape about it:

Jagex enables COMMANDS!? (and other things)

The commands have always been there, just disabled for the version users could use. I always used to enable them back when I had the MoparScape Revolution cheat client out there, so you could use them on the official runescape, I guess it’s about time they let everyone use them without hacks.

item.title: Nice dev console
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

RuneScape

Z-buffering

RuneScape's game engine gets an update today in the form of z-buffering, a rendering technique that should help to improve the general look of the game, allows us to fix some common graphical issues, and which means we can create more complex...

We’ve enabled access to our developer console to allow players a small selection of commands, which you may prove useful in tracking down the cause of more technical issues with the client on your computer. Just hit the back quote key (`), also known as the grave accent key, which is found left of the ‘1’ key on most QWERTY keyboards. Input ‘help’ into the developer console for more information and a list of available commands.

http://www.uppimg.com/W2298OE.png

Read full topic
